wikipedia_page.main: Mark Andrew Druce (born 3 March 1974) is an English former professional footballer who played as a forward for various teams in the Football League.

response: In August 1996, he was purchased by Danny Bergara at Second Division side Rotherham United for a club record £150,000. He was brought in to replace Shaun Goater and Nigel Jemson. He scored once in 24 appearances in 1996–97. He lost his first team place to Mark Druce, and was sent out on loan to Brian Horton's Huddersfield Town, who were playing one level above the Millers. He made 11 appearances for the Terriers, without finding the net. He returned to Millmoor at the end of the season to find that Rotherham had been relegated in his absence.
